job_title: Principal Data Scientist - Ziff Media Group
job_Description: At Ziff Media Group we believe that gaining valuable insights using our data is core to our future success. Our Data Science team is seeking a Principal Data Scientist to drive search-oriented modeling and automated language processing to make savings opportunities more discoverable by consumers. The data science team at Ziff Media Group (RetailMenot, Offers.com, Mashable, PCMag) leverages data to optimize key business metrics and enable smarter experiences. We build, test and iterate on ML models, learning from and leveraging datasets with millions of daily visits. As part of the Data Science team you will work together with software engineers, data scientists and data engineers leveraging the latest technology, bringing new ideas to the table, and helping improve the world’s largest savings destination. Some of the technologies that we use today include AWS (EMR), Spark, Docker, Luigi. In this role you will collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of data scientists, software engineers, data engineers, business analysts, product managers, and other internal customers to find the best opportunities to apply data science in RetailMeNot's business. You will lead key initiatives through development, iterative experimentation, and productization of winning solutions. We can provide you access to large-scale master and analytics data sets; in return you will see the application and impact of your work to millions of users. If you’re someone who enjoys taking on new challenges, working in a rapidly changing environment, learning new skills, and applying it all to solve large and impactful business problems, then we want you to be a part of the team! This position is fully remote and we encourage applicants nationwide! Who You Are You have an MS/PhD in NLP, computational linguistics, machine learning, applied mathematics, or related quantitative field or equivalent self-study You have a deep knowledge of natural language processing, text mining and statistics Have a track record of building scalable and robust personalized search engines preferably in the retail space You bring specific experience in Neural Networks, preferably RNNs, LSTMs and Deep Learning You have experience with Topic Modeling, Parsing, Semantic Composition and Relationship Extraction Experience in productization of machine learning algorithms You have the ability to apply a pragmatic approach to problem solving, establishing conceptual connections to data sources, understanding relationships among data, and comfort with uncertainties/approximations You have great communication and collaboration skills Work well with ambiguity and are a curious individual, always striving to learn about the latest developments in this space Are excited by the idea of mentoring junior engineers/scientists on data science techniques, process, and new technologies while establishing best practices Have experience with DAG schedulers (Luigi, Airflow etc.) and cloud platforms (AWS and/or GCP); Familiarity with Kubernetes, Docker is a plus Experience with big data frameworks such as Spark and proficient in languages such as Scala, and/or Python, SQL What You'll Do You'll mentor junior engineers/scientists on data science techniques, process, and new technologies You will use machine learning and NLP techniques to design and develop system for search, recommendations and attribute extraction You will design and implement scalable algorithms and models, as well as repeatable workflows You will develop and code software programs, algorithms and automated processes to interpret unstructured textual data from various sources and contexts You will communicate effectively to different audiences, both technical and non-technical, through good storytelling and data visualization  This is a remote/office based position which may be performed anywhere in the United States except for within the state of Colorado.  #ZiffMediaGroup #LI-MG1

Coursera was launched in 2012 by two Stanford Computer Science professors, Andrew Ng and Daphne Koller, with a mission to provide universal access to world-class learning. It is now one of the largest online learning platforms in the world, with 87 million registered learners as of June 30, 2021. Coursera partners with over 200 leading university and industry partners to offer a broad catalog of content and credentials, including Guided Projects, courses, Specializations, certificates, and bachelor’s and master’s degrees. Institutions around the world use Coursera to upskill and reskill their employees, citizens, and students in many high-demand fields, including data science, technology, and business. Coursera became a B Corp in February 2021. The Skills Consultant will have the ambitious responsibility of helping Coursera understand the needs of our Data Science Academy B2B Enterprise customers. These buyers are responsible for the training, upskilling, and reskilling of professionals at their company in Data Science. You will conduct qualitative and quantitative research with our internal teams, Enterprise customers, and Enterprise learners to understand what are the greatest pain points and needs for our Enterprise customers. For the fullest picture, you will also conduct market research and a competitive analysis, and marry these learnings with the insights you have gleaned internally and from customers. The output of your work will be a skills needs/gap analysis, the conceptual grouping of skills into “SkillSets” so they make sense to learners and can be “sold” as a package to companies, and recommendations on how these skills ladder to content that Coursera should source. You will be expected to present on your findings and output to the highest level stakeholders at Coursera with a data-forward and strategically cohesive narrative.  Responsibilities Collaborate with internal Coursera teams including Content Strategy, Enterprise, Marketing, and Data Science to gain context on SkillSets work, and ensure that your work dovetails Work with SkillSets: identifying the relevant skills, content and roles to create SkillSets for Data Science Academy. Ensure content quality for SkillSets before launch. Update SkillSets based on all feedback collected quarterly. Review and validate questions included in LevelSets Conduct qualitative research (e.g., interviews, surveys) with Coursera internal stakeholders and B2B Enterprise buyers to understand pain points and needs of the Data Science Academy Enterprise buyer Review nuanced consumption data showing both B2B deals and enrollments in the skills that underlie the Data Science Academy Conduct market research and a competitive analysis to round out your view of pain points and opportunities - placing insights in a broader context Present on your findings and output to the highest level stakeholders at Coursera with a data-forward and strategically cohesive narrative, join sales calls with enterprise clients to help them understand the benefits of the academy.   Basic Qualifications 5+ years of experience in Data Science and related industry trends. Experience with data and analytics Demonstrated history with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint Preferred Qualifications Master’s, Doctorate, or equivalent work experience in your field Strong research skills, including persona research and interviewing Ability to manage and communicate with multiple stakeholders Experience with B2B businesses - especially international companies Passion for learning and edtech in particular If this opportunity interests you, you might like these courses on Coursera: IBM Data Science Applied Data Science with Python Coursera is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and considers all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected class. If you are an individual with a disability and require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process, please contact us at accommodations@coursera.org.   Please review our CCPA Applicant Notice here.

Responsibilities: As a data scientist with our team, you will be working with our federal clients to develop and maintain data guidelines, analytic programs, and database managment systems to support programs essential to providing healthcare directly to nearly half of all Americans, and broadly impacting the entire U.S. healthcare system. In your role you will learn and understand existing and planned data architectures and models, and help to develop creative approaches to modernization and design for analysis. You will also contribute to exploring emerging technology trends in data management and data science, and developing engineering proofs-of-concept to understand potential applicability of these technologies. An important part of this work will be integrating traditional database paradigms with NoSQL and cloud data paradigms, with a focus on supporting machine learning/artificial intelligence (ML/AI) and natural language processing (NLP) applications. This role is client-facing, and involves collaboration with a wide range of partners, from senior agency leadership, to subject matter experts, to contractors performing project work. Client Engagement: • Begin developing relationships one level up and two levels down. Identify and support opportunities to expand project scope beyond current deliverable and actively share information about clients’ emerging support needs and trends with team members and management. · Participate on proposals Qualifications: Required minimum skills  and knowledge: Bachelor’s and minimum 5 years of related experience, or Master’s and 3 years related experience, or Doctorate and 1 year related experience; or equivalent experience of 16+ years in lieu of degree Experience with SQL databases and data models (especially PostgresQL, Amazon Aurora) Experience with programming in Python, JavaScript/TypeScript, or other similar languages Experience with NoSQL databases (e.g. MongoDB, Neo4J) Experience designing data models and approaches Experience working in the cloud environment (e.g. AWS) Desired  skills and knowledge: Experience with designing, implementing, and using REST APIs RDF/OWL, SPARQL, and Semantic Web technologies Data catalogs and data management Statistical and ML analytics and modeling (e.g. R, Spark, etc.) Applied Natural Language Processing Govermnent healthcare data experience a plus FHIR or NIEM experience a plus Overview: Consistent with Executive Order 14042, this position requires proof of COVID-19 vaccination (fully vaccinated), subject to approved ADA or religious accommodations and client requirements. Requisition ID: R10007782  Category:  Engineering Location:  Linthicum - MD, United States of America Citizenship Required:  United States Citizenship Clearance Type:  Secret Telecommute:  Yes- May Consider Occasional/Part-Time Teleworking for this position Shift:  1st Shift (United States of America) Travel Required:  No Positions Available:  1   At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.  “Transform the future of technology…” The qualified applicant will become part of Northrop Grumman's Algorithms and Exploitation group in Mission Systems focused upon the increasingly important technology areas of automatic target recognition, sensor fusion, network centric systems, computer vision, machine learning, and artificial intelligence.Roles and Responsibilities: Lead and participate in multi-disciplinary, collaborative teams and contribute to the development of novel sensing solutions and surveillance technologies. The development cycle will include the integration of data collection experiments and cutting-edge exploitation algorithms into both embedded and non-embedded platforms. Potential solutions will be verified against live sensor data. Sensor types span all domains and include active/passive radar, electro-optic/infrared imaging systems, and sonar. Duties will include the development of signal and image processing algorithms for exploitation of conventional and advanced concept sensor data in geospatial contexts. Resulting algorithms may be integrated into state-of-the-art software products that could potentially run on multi-core, multi-purpose processing architectures, embedded processors, FPGAs, GPUs, or other emerging technologies. Additional tasks include defining software and system interfaces, system integration and testing, and field support of experiments and demonstrations. Work products include written reports, presentations, and project proposals. Occasional travel for meetings and data collections may be required.Basic Qualifications for a level 5:BS with 14+, MS with 12+, or Ph.D. with 9+ years of experience in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Physics, Applied Mathematics, or related technical fields.A demonstrated ability to perform innovative, applied research and develop sophisticated algorithms under computational or other resource constraints.Experience with conventional software engineering principles, including code maintenance, coding standards, and version control.Experience with algorithm implementations in MATLAB and software development in C, C++, Python, and/or Objective C.Preferred Qualifications:Proven expertise in remote sensing, including active radar imaging and/or passive electro-optic and infrared imaging systems.Proven experience with formulating innovative solutions to algorithm development, initiating and fostering client relationships, and executing projects in compliance with cost, schedule, and technical requirements.Proven experience in developing rapid prototype solutions from concept to design, implementation, initial testing, and integration.Proven experience with presenting and speaking at customer demonstrations, symposia, and conferences.Proven experience with open source computer vision and machine learning libraries (e.g., OpenCV, TensorFlow, and Caffe), Unix/Linux operating systems, and multi-threaded/parallel computing is of additional benefit.   Salary Range:  179800 - 269600   Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.   Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO. U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

Company Summary: Crown Castle works around the country to build and maintain the infrastructure behind the world’s most revolutionary technologies. As the largest shared infrastructure provider in the United States, Crown Castle owns, operates and leases more than 40,000 cell towers, 80,000 small cells and over 80,000 route miles of fiber across every major US market. This nationwide portfolio of communications infrastructure connects cities and communities to essential data, technology, and wireless service – bringing information, ideas and innovations to the people and businesses that need them. Crown Castle is a NYSE S&P 500 and Fortune 500 company and one of the largest Real Estate Investment Trusts in the United States with an enterprise value of approximately $110 billion.   Position Title: Data Engineer II, Data Science    Role: As a Data Engineer, you join a team responsible for applying data science and machine learning techniques to deliver business value at Crown Castle. You will play a critical role in building efficient, supportable, and scalable data pipelines to serve a variety of business use cases. The data engineer collaborates with senior data engineers, data scientists, subject matter experts, and other data consumers to build ETL and ELT data pipelines. As a data engineer in the data science team, you will have the opportunity to apply your foundational knowledge of machine learning algorithms to convert models developed by data scientists into production grade executables. Crown Castle is an innovative technology company that develops software which provides industry leading communication infrastructure across the US market. The Data Science team creates innovative predictive and prescriptive solutions to improve business processes, reduce costs, and drive revenue. We are a tight knit team where you can grow your skills in an environment that emphasizes creativity, collaboration, and empowerment. You will work on a data driven agile team with some of the most talented and dynamic professionals to plan, design, commit, and deliver highly impactful business capabilities. If you enjoy using technology to solve complex problems and have a growth mind set, then this opportunity is for you.   Responsibilities:   Analyze business problems and create data solutions.  Create big-data pipelines to feed machine learning algorithms.  Deploy machine-learning models to production and monitor them over time.  Process and clean large datasets into a format suitable for machine learning.  Maintain a readable and reusable code base.  Own projects and see them through from idea to deployment.  Communicate with technical and business teams about data engineering solutions.  Supply accurate task level of effort estimates to leadership.  Seek practical methods to optimize data pipeline cost, efficiency, and supportability.   Expectations   Self-motivated individual who can handle ambiguous/undefined problems and think abstractly to deliver results  Demonstrate a strong sense of ownership, urgency, and drive as well as the ability to work well with diverse teams.  Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions to business users and other technical teams  Exhibits a passion for delivering data solutions through continuous learning, applying new data engineering concepts, and knowledge sharing with peers   Education/Certifications   BS Degree in Math, Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or other qualitative discipline  Cloud Data Engineering or Data Science Certifications are a plus (ex. AI-102, DP100, DP203)   Experience/Minimum Requirements   3+ years of experience delivering data solutions  2+ years of experience with one or more big data tools: Databricks Delta Lake, Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.  Experience designing, developing, implementing, and maintaining cloud-based data stores to manage data  2+ years of experience with cloud data engineering in Azure, AWS, or GCP  1+ years of experience using cloud data pipeline orchestration tools such as Azure Data Factory  Advanced knowledge of SQL  Strong programming skills in Python, Java, or Scala  Working knowledge of API frameworks, OData protocol, and stream-based data acquisition methods  Fundamental knowledge of parametric and non-parametric machine learning algorithms.  Experience deploying machine learning models into production is a plus  Crown Castle is a federal contractor, and the COVID-19 vaccination is a requirement of employment by your start date to comply with Executive Order 14042.   Working Conditions:  This is a remote role with the expectation of on-site/in-person collaboration with teammates and stakeholders for moments that matter and may require up to 10% travel.
